translations.name: Lifewords
translations.description_short: Lifewords exists because the Bible is for everyone. Their work aims to help people everywhere experience the Bible’s life words as good news for their lives, and for the world.

translations.title: Yesu Kilisi gbãa vĩ à wá sua ba
Jesus Christ has power to save us
LCWords app (iOS)
translations.description: READ & SHARE life-changing words from the Bible in one of the 12 supported languages! The LCWords app will deliver a carefully selected Bible verse to you every day. Read, be inspired, and pass on the inspiration to others via Facebook, Google+, Twitter, SMS or email.

translations.title: Jesus: A Life Story (epub/mobi)
translations.description: An e-book telling the story of Jesus life from his birth, his travels and his teachings, through to his death and resurrection. MOBI for Kindle.

translations.title: Jesus: An Introduction (epub/mobi)
translations.description: An e-book that does what the title suggests, introducing Jesus through stories from the gospels. Each story tells of an encounter with Jesus, the ordinary people who met him, and were never the same again. MOBI for Kindle.

translations.title: You Matter (epub/mobi)
translations.description: The message "You matter to God" is presented using the parable of the Prodigal Son. An e-book.

translations.title: Lay Down Your Cloak
translations.description:
Easter Journey - Day 1
Bring on the revolution!

We have seen too many years of stagnation, resignation - a country occupied, a people oppressed, a faltering and compromised leadership locked in endless cycles of pointless debate. It is time for action. Let us turn some tables. We have got a radical new hope, we are coming through your gates, and there is nothing you can do about it. We have got a man worth following, we have got the hearts and minds, the public vote, and they are throwing down their cloaks in the street. Here comes Jesus and we are right behind him.

translations.title: Destroy This Temple
translations.description:
Easter Journey - Day 2
This is not what I expected.

Give me the conquering hero, someone I can fight for, a man I can be proud to serve. Give me a movement to be part of, a rule to live by, a cause. Give me a mission, a challenge. But you ask me to die. This is not what I expected.

translations.title: Beautiful Things
translations.description:
Easter Journey - Day 3
A gesture of love so extravagant, so over the top, so extraordinary. The audacity of it, something so valuable, so irreplaceable, dashed at Jesus feet - it is just the sheer all or nothing attitude of it all. There is no going back; once it is done it is done. So why do I feel uncomfortable? Is it that I just would not dare? I do not dare. I just do not know if I am prepared to take what is precious to me, and dash it at Jesus' feet. I am just not prepared.

translations.title: Uncharted Territory
translations.description:
Easter Journey - Day 4
It should not be this confusing.

Everything is couched in vagueness, all the instructions are cryptic. I start out one way with confidence and a clear direction in mind, and always end up lost. Or not so much lost, just always travelling and never getting any closer. Always journeying and never arriving. Would it not have been so much easier if you had given us a destination?

translations.title: Remember Me
translations.description:
Easter Journey - Day 5

It feels like the end, as though the hands have gripped, the muscles have tensed, and any second now the rug will be whipped out from under us all. I feel overshadowed, undermined. I am afraid. I am afraid that my hopes were in vain, that everything will fall away and I will be left here with nothing, alone. Nobody told me I might have to go alone.

translations.title: Finished
translations.description:
Easter Journey - Day 6
What is the trick? What is the secret? Who is ready with the twist, the final reveal?
But there is no trick, no secret. This is it.
Where then are the optimists among us? Who is going to tell me it is going to be okay? Where are the prophets, the wise men, the ones who can explain? Has anyone worked out what happens next?
Where is everyone?

translations.title: Watch This Space
translations.description:
Easter Journey - Day 7
Now the freefall and the whirling darkness.
There can be no talk of the future here. Nor talk of the past. No talk at all. There is only falling.
You cannot pick yourself up if you have not hit the ground.

translations.title: Dead Man Walking
translations.description:
Easter Journey - Day 8
There is a time for words, and a time for silence. A time to reflect, to dissect and understand, and there is a time to just stand and look.
To behold.
Later comes the thankfulness, the future and the promise. Thankfulness for this bruised reed not broken, this smouldering wick not snuffed out; that our fragile hopes have not been crushed, and we are still standing when the lights come back on.
But first, there is a time to just stand and look.

translations.title: Life Changing Words (email)
translations.description: We're offering you Life Changing Words - wisdom and strength from God's book in your email with the frequency of your choice. Free of charge.

translations.title: Jesus: A Life Story (epub/mobi)
translations.description: An e-book telling the story of Jesus life from his birth, his travels and his teachings, through to his death and resurrection. MOBI for Kindle.

translations.title: Jesus: An Introduction (epub/mobi)
translations.description: An e-book that does what the title suggests, introducing Jesus through stories from the gospels. Each story tells of an encounter with Jesus, the ordinary people who met him, and were never the same again. MOBI for Kindle.

translations.title: Lay Down Your Cloak
translations.description:
Easter Journey - Day 1
Bring on the revolution!

We have seen too many years of stagnation, resignation - a country occupied, a people oppressed, a faltering and compromised leadership locked in endless cycles of pointless debate. It is time for action. Let us turn some tables. We have got a radical new hope, we are coming through your gates, and there is nothing you can do about it. We have got a man worth following, we have got the hearts and minds, the public vote, and they are throwing down their cloaks in the street. Here comes Jesus and we are right behind him.

translations.title: Destroy This Temple
translations.description:
Easter Journey - Day 2
This is not what I expected.

Give me the conquering hero, someone I can fight for, a man I can be proud to serve. Give me a movement to be part of, a rule to live by, a cause. Give me a mission, a challenge. But you ask me to die. This is not what I expected.

translations.title: Beautiful Things
translations.description:
Easter Journey - Day 3
A gesture of love so extravagant, so over the top, so extraordinary. The audacity of it, something so valuable, so irreplaceable, dashed at Jesus feet - it is just the sheer all or nothing attitude of it all. There is no going back; once it is done it is done. So why do I feel uncomfortable? Is it that I just would not dare? I do not dare. I just do not know if I am prepared to take what is precious to me, and dash it at Jesus' feet. I am just not prepared.

translations.title: Uncharted Territory
translations.description:
Easter Journey - Day 4
It should not be this confusing.

Everything is couched in vagueness, all the instructions are cryptic. I start out one way with confidence and a clear direction in mind, and always end up lost. Or not so much lost, just always travelling and never getting any closer. Always journeying and never arriving. Would it not have been so much easier if you had given us a destination?

translations.title: Remember Me
translations.description:
Easter Journey - Day 5

It feels like the end, as though the hands have gripped, the muscles have tensed, and any second now the rug will be whipped out from under us all. I feel overshadowed, undermined. I am afraid. I am afraid that my hopes were in vain, that everything will fall away and I will be left here with nothing, alone. Nobody told me I might have to go alone.

translations.title: Finished
translations.description:
Easter Journey - Day 6
What is the trick? What is the secret? Who is ready with the twist, the final reveal?
But there is no trick, no secret. This is it.
Where then are the optimists among us? Who is going to tell me it is going to be okay? Where are the prophets, the wise men, the ones who can explain? Has anyone worked out what happens next?
Where is everyone?

translations.title: Watch This Space
translations.description:
Easter Journey - Day 7
Now the freefall and the whirling darkness.
There can be no talk of the future here. Nor talk of the past. No talk at all. There is only falling.
You cannot pick yourself up if you have not hit the ground.

translations.title: Dead Man Walking
translations.description:
Easter Journey - Day 8
There is a time for words, and a time for silence. A time to reflect, to dissect and understand, and there is a time to just stand and look.
To behold.
Later comes the thankfulness, the future and the promise. Thankfulness for this bruised reed not broken, this smouldering wick not snuffed out; that our fragile hopes have not been crushed, and we are still standing when the lights come back on.
But first, there is a time to just stand and look.

translations.title: Life Changing Words (email)
translations.description: We're offering you Life Changing Words - wisdom and strength from God's book in your email with the frequency of your choice. Free of charge.
